security_audit.summary: SKILL.md is pure documentation describing a Bash CLI tool. The ~17K LOC implementation is external. Described capabilities (git operations, agent orchestration, GitHub API) are appropriate for repo management. Security controls (denylists, secret scanning, quality gates) are documented. External install script from raw GitHub URL requires verification before deployment.

medium_findings.title: External install script dependency
medium_findings.description: The skill references an external install script from raw GitHub URL: `curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Dicklesworthstone/repo_updater/main/install.sh | bash`. This pattern could be abused if the source repository is compromised or if the URL is modified. Users should verify the install script contents before execution.

low_findings.title: Large codebase increases attack surface
low_findings.description: The implementation is approximately 17,700 lines of Bash code. Large codebases have increased attack surface for potential vulnerabilities. Review the external repository for security hardening.

low_findings.title: AI agent orchestration complexity
low_findings.description: The skill spawns Claude Code sessions via ntm integration for automated review and commit workflows. This requires careful configuration to prevent unintended code execution. Security guardrails (denylists, secret scanning) are documented but should be verified in practice.

content.user_title: Sync GitHub repos with AI code review
content.value_statement: Managing dozens of Git repositories manually wastes hours. RU automates synchronization, discovers issues and PRs across all repos, and orchestrates AI agents to review changes at scale.
actual_capabilities: Sync multiple GitHub repositories in parallel with work-stealing queue
Query GitHub for open issues and PRs across all repos with priority scoring
Spawn Claude Code sessions in tmux for AI-assisted code review
Process dirty repos automatically with agent-sweep workflow
Run quality gates (ShellCheck, tests, lint) before committing
Generate structured commit messages via AI analysis
limitations: Requires git, gh CLI, and optionally ntm for full functionality
Private repos require GitHub authentication via GH_TOKEN
The actual implementation is an external 17K LOC Bash script
Quality gate commands are auto-detected and may not cover all project types

use_cases.title: Multi-repo synchronization
use_cases.description: Keep dozens of project repositories updated in parallel with intelligent retry and rate limiting.

use_cases.title: AI-assisted code review
use_cases.description: Let Claude Code review issues and PRs across your entire project portfolio automatically.

use_cases.title: Automated commit workflow
use_cases.description: Automatically process uncommitted changes with AI-generated commits and quality gates.

prompt_templates.title: Sync all repos
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ru sync to update all configured repositories using parallel mode

prompt_templates.title: Check repo status
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ru status --json to get a machine-readable overview of all repo states

prompt_templates.title: Plan AI reviews
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ru review --plan --max-repos=10 to discover and prioritize issues for AI review

prompt_templates.title: Apply review changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ru review --apply --push after reviewing AI-generated suggestions

best_practices: Use --dry-run before first sync to preview changes
Configure denylist patterns to protect sensitive files from auto-commit
Set --secret-scan=block to prevent accidentally pushing credentials
anti_patterns: Running agent-sweep without reviewing the generated plans first
Skipping quality gates when processing production repositories
Using --force on shared branches without team coordination

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Claude Code is fully supported via ntm integration. Works with Claude and Codex for code review tasks.

faq.question: How many repositories can it handle?
faq.answer: Tested with 47+ repos. Parallel mode (-j8) scales efficiently. Rate limiting adapts to GitHub API limits.

faq.question: How does it integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Uses ntm robot mode to spawn Claude Code sessions in tmux panes for multi-agent review workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Secret scanning and file denylists prevent credential exposure. Runs locally; only GitHub API calls leave your machine.

faq.question: Why are repos being skipped?
faq.answer: Common reasons: not a git repo, missing git email, shallow clone, detached HEAD, or rebase in progress.

faq.question: How is this different from git submodule?
faq.answer: Each repo stays independent with full history. No special submodule configuration required. Works with any git workflow.
